challenges.name: Size matters
challenges.content: Try to have the projects single file or uncompressed size of under 1MB

challenges.name: Picture this
challenges.content: A picture can be worth a thousand words and makes everything more bright and lively

challenges.name: Click click click
challenges.content:
Have some interactive parts in your project to bring it more alive and interesting

e.g. point-in-click, puzzle, etc.

challenges.name: Make a scene
challenges.content: Try to include some type of cutscene or story to help with following alone

challenges.name: Why did that happen?
challenges.content:
Try to include an event that will happen at a random time that could help or ruin the experience

e.g. loot drops, weather, etc.

challenges.name: Rewarding
challenges.content: Add some kind of rewards for a specific action that may or may not help out later on

challenges.name: ABXY
challenges.content: Have built-in game controller support in your project for the ones that want to try it on the big screen and near the computer

challenges.name: All by itself
challenges.content: Make the project run as standalone software without needing a browser or other installed software on the computer

rules.name: Do your own work
rules.content: No using AI generated content in project

rules.name: Giving back
rules.content: If you use someones project give them credit

rules.name: No issues here
rules.content: Make sure to test project fully before the day

rules.name: No internet, no problem
rules.content: Most work fully offline and locally (news is allowed)

rules.name: Sharing is good
rules.content: If possible, source code should to shared with the tutors or friends

rules.name: What and where
rules.content:
Show where external resources is coming from, if any 

e.g. scripts, styles, APIs, CDNs, RSS, etc.

tips.name: Do it with style
tips.content: Pick a style and theme that your happy with and stick with it

tips.name: Future proof
tips.content: Make it easily updatable, scalable and maintainable in the long term

tips.name: Versioning
tips.content:
Use versioned releases so there's a back up if something goes wrong 

e.g. 1.0.0, 1.1.0, etc.

tips.name: Less work for you
tips.content:
Automated pipelines are useful to make your life easier with common tasks

e.g. GitHub Actions, scripts, etc.

tips.name: Whats happening
tips.content: Add news to the project so people can know whats going on

tips.name: Another eye on it
tips.content: Have your project tested by a small group of people
